sentences.en: He praised her ability to fight corruption and "entrenched bureaucracy, " and cited her working-class roots and her ability to understand the problems of working people.
sentences.cn: 他赞扬了佩林打击腐败和“根深蒂固的官僚主义”的能力，并提到她植根于工薪阶层并能够了解其面临的问题。

sentences.en: He praised her ability to fight corruption and “entrenched bureaucracy,” and cited her working-class roots and her ability to understand the problems of working people.
sentences.cn: 他赞扬了佩林打击腐败和"根深蒂固的官僚主义"的能力，并提到她植根于工薪阶层并能够了解其面临的问题。

sentences.en: Her position was strongly entrenched; she had managed to secure the support of the king.
sentences.cn: 她的地位是十分巩固; 她已经设法获得了国王的声援.

sentences.en: If the enemy dares to attack us in these entrenched positions, we will make short work of them.
sentences.cn: 如果敌人胆敢进攻我们固守的阵地, 我们就消灭他们.

sentences.en: In this sense, putting a woman in the White House will mark a new milestone in American democracy: it can break the entrenched spell—our cognitive biases for hunks—imposed by the ghost of evolution.
sentences.cn: 从这个角度来说，选出一位女性入主白宫将成为美国民主新的里程碑：它将破除进化幽灵加在我们身上根深蒂固的魔咒，即我们钟情大个头肌肉男的认知偏差。

sentences.en: Mayer, for example, notes that women have more opportunities in Silicon Valley because there’s no entrenched hierarchy there.
sentences.cn: 例如，迈尔解释说，在硅谷女人拥有更多的机会，因为那里没有根深蒂固的官僚结构。

sentences.en: Now, three years later, Dr Lord was solidly entrenched at Felding - Roth.
sentences.cn: 现在, 三年过去了, 洛德博士在费尔汀 -- 罗斯公司稳稳地站住了脚.

sentences.en: She is entrenched in her right - wing views.
sentences.cn: 她的 右翼 观点根深蒂固.

sentences.en: Television seems to be firmly entrenched as the number one medium for national advertising.
sentences.cn: 电视看来要在全国广告媒介中牢固地占据头等位置.

sentences.en: The army entrenched themselves near the shore.
sentences.cn: 军队在海岸附近挖壕沟固守.

sentences.en: The army entrenched themselves on the other side of the river.
sentences.cn: 军队在河的另一边固守著自己.

sentences.en: The enemy was strongly entrenched upon the othr side of the river.
sentences.cn: 敌人在河的彼岸以坚固的壕沟防护自己.

sentences.en: The enemy were entrenched beyond the hill.
sentences.cn: 敌人在山的那一边以壕沟防守.

sentences.en: The enemy were strongly entrenched on the other side of the river.
sentences.cn: 敌军在河的对岸用坚固的壕沟防守.

sentences.en: The recession remains deeply entrenched.
sentences.cn: 经济衰退仍然根深蒂固。

sentences.en: The term condensation is now firmly entrenched in the literature of polymer science.
sentences.cn: 缩合这个术语,现在在聚合物科学文献中已牢固的确定.

sentences.en: These concepts were firmly entrenched in the mathematical formulation of classical mechanics.
sentences.cn: 这些概念在经典力学的数学表述中根深蒂固.

sentences.en: They entrenched themselves at once.
sentences.cn: 他们立刻挖壕防护自己.

sentences.en: They entrenched themselves behind a wall of tradition.
sentences.cn: 他们以传统为挡箭牌来保护自己.

sentences.en: They hold that, once entrenched, only Lincoln's bellicose policy could have eradicated it.
sentences.cn: 他们相信一旦确立，只有林肯的好战政策才能彻底摧毁它。

words.tran_cn: 根深蒂固的；确立的，不容易改的
确立；保证；挖掘壕沟（entrench的过去分词）

trans.tran_cn: 根深蒂固的，牢固的，固守的
trans.tran_en: strongly established and not likely to change — often used to show disapproval

trans.tran_cn: 用壕沟围绕或保护…( entrench的过去式和过去分词 )，牢固地确立…
